intro: Ryssopterys dealbata, commonly known as the white-veined fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, bi-colored fronds that feature a pale midrib contrasting with darker green leaflets. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its reproductive structures, including spore-bearing sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. The botanical features of Ryssopterys dealbata make it a notable species within the family Blechnaceae.
